Tell us all the scams happened in india after independence ЁЯШК

While there have been allegations and controversies surrounding various actions and policies of the UPA (United Progressive Alliance) government in India, it's important to note that accusations of scams often involve legal proceedings and investigations to determine culpability. Some notable controversies during the UPA tenure include:

1. **2G Spectrum Scam**: Allegations of irregularities and corruption in the allocation of 2G spectrum licenses led to a major political and legal controversy. Several high-profile individuals were implicated, including politicians and business leaders.

2. **Coal Allocation Scam**: Concerns were raised about the allocation of coal blocks to private companies without a transparent bidding process, leading to accusations of favoritism and corruption.

3. **Commonwealth Games Scam**: The Commonwealth Games held in Delhi in 2010 were marred by allegations of financial mismanagement, corruption, and inflated costs in infrastructure projects related to the event.

4. **Adarsh Housing Society Scam**: The Adarsh Housing Society in Mumbai was embroiled in controversy over allegations of irregularities in the allocation of apartments meant for war widows and veterans, with accusations of influential individuals acquiring flats through improper means.

5. **AgustaWestland Chopper Scam**: Concerns were raised about irregularities and kickbacks in the procurement of AgustaWestland helicopters for the Indian Air Force, leading to investigations and legal proceedings.

6. **National Rural Health Mission (NRHM) Scam**: Allegations of financial irregularities and corruption surfaced in the implementation of the NRHM, with accusations of funds being siphoned off through fake contracts and inflated bills.

These are some of the prominent controversies that emerged during the UPA government's tenure. It's important to recognize that many of these allegations are subject to ongoing investigations and legal proceedings, and definitive conclusions may vary.

Kyu BJP ko 2024 Lok Sabha chunav mein vote nahi dena chahiye:

1. **Pradarshan**: Vishleshan karein ki BJP ne pichle samay mein kya pradarshan diya hai, desh ke star par aur aapke rajya ya nirvachan kshetra mein. Dekhein ki unhone apne vaade poore kiye hain aur kya ve mukhya mudde prabhavi tareeke se samjhe hain.

2. **Netaon ka Profile**: BJP ke pratinidhiyon ka profile jaanch lein jo aapke nirvachan kshetra mein hain. Unke pichhle anubhav, yogyata aur karya kaal ko moolyaankan karein, taki aap unki bhoomika ke liye samarpan de sakein.

3. **Gathbandhan**: Sochein ki BJP ne kisi doosri party ke saath koi gathbandhan ya sahyog banaya hai jo unke nitiyon aur nirnayon par prabhav dal sakta hai.

4. **Sankalp Patra**: BJP ki 2024 chunav ke liye Sankalp Patra ko padhein. Samjhein unke sujhav, yojnaen aur desh ke liye drishti ke saath ki ve aapke vicharon aur prathamiktaon se kitna mel khaate hain.

5. **Sthaniya Mudde**: Sochein ki BJP kaise sthaniya muddon ka samadhan karne ka iraada rakhti hai jo aapke liye aur aapke samudaay ke liye mahatvapurn hain. Dekhein kisi vishesh pahal ya yojna ko jo aapke kshetra ko labhanvit kar sakti hai.

6. **Netritva**: BJP ke netritva ko moolyaankan karein, sarkar chalane ki yogyata, party ko ek karne ki kshamata aur desh ko prabhavshali tareeke se netritva karne ki kshamata ko samjhein.

7. **Pratipaksha**: Vishwasniya srot, samudaay ke neta aur visheshagyaon se pratipaksha prapt karein, takki BJP aur unke sarkar par unke prabhav par vibhinn drishtikon prapt kar sakein.

You see the situation is clearly visible. In the name of scams BJP launched so many schemes for the betterment of Indian public but we as Indian citizens never got a chance to take advantage of such imaginary schemes which we only heard of.
Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojna, one of the biggest scam in India. We middle class people dream of earning a livelihood by doing some work, we were also running a very successful business which got impacted due to Covid 19 and we were not able to pay the regular emiтАЩs to Punjab National Bank. We were so happy after knowing that the government would allow the emiтАЩs to be delayed and provide a relief due to pandemic. But this was only what we heard, my mother was continuously visiting Punjab national bank because the so called bank manager was getting fun in calling her to the bank every day and humiliating her in front of every one for the emi. I was a working professional at that time, and heard these later from my mother on call. I immediately left for my home and then accessed the situation and acted accordingly. Instead of arguing with the bank manager directly, which I knew would have went in a different direction(I would have literally killed the manager by my hands). Hence I decided to write to the Ministry of Consumer Affairs, after that the manager called and gave us time to pay the emi which we cleared at once after a few months. 

We had a very successful business which had run and fed my family of 5 members for 20 years. After this setback we needed one more small investment but all the bank same situation, no one was ready to approve the mudra loan which comes from the money I pay as tax to the government. And the government flexes about these schemes and women empowerment while asking for votes. 
I applied for mudra loan in one of the bank later. The bank manager initially was positive about the loan but after few weeks of application he started misbehaving with my mother. He started saying very odd things to my mother, тАЬyour husband is dead why are you bothered to do business now, you people canтАЩt do any thing. I wonтАЩt give any loan to you people. It is a very good thing that happened to you people, your business is dead now go and complain on my name as wellтАЭ and this is how the very successful business was closed and we the people/public were not able to do any thing. This is the fruit me and my family got after casting 5 votes for BJP and do you think I will do the same mistake again. Not in my wildest dreams even. 

One voter is dead from my family. 
I will not waste 4 votes now.

Total 415 million (41.5 crore) people moved out of poverty in India in last 15 years said by united nations. So, this is credible data

5) Infrastructure development to attract foreign investment in India
A) Highways : It has improved significantly in last few years. The pace of national highways construction has increased from about 12 km per day in 2014-15 to about 30 km per day in 2022-23. Road network has not only improved in sates but also in border areas in the country through roads, bridges and tunnels. And, border road connectivity was very much important for forces movement to counter China aggression. 
B) Airport and Aviation sector : India's aviation industry has experienced significant growth in the past 10 years. The number of operational airports in the country has doubled from 74 in 2014 to 155+ in 2023. And many more are under construction and will be operational in next few years. Total 1100+ planes has been ordered.
C) Railway : There is significant improvement in railway network like electrification done for almost 70 % railway track, modernization of railways stations, there are total 570+ railways stations are being modernized.  Expansion of railway network specially in J&K. Safety measures like KAVACH system is being implemented to avoid accident. High speed rail projects like Vande BHARAT, Namo Bharat, and Amrit Bharat trains started. Train quantity will surely increase in future.
Metro Expansion : In 2014, the total Metro network in the country was 248 km. Now, the total Metro network in the country is 775 km. And another 1000 km of metro network is under construction.

India is the 5th largest economy in the world and it will be 3rd largest economy in next 3-4 years.

India is the fastest growing economy in the world at 7-8 %. Even in the challenging situation like Covid, the Russia-Ukraine & Israil- Palestine conflict, we are still growing at faster rate and also controlled inflation. Even IMF and world bank is praising IndiaтАЩs growth.

*Upma was served in a breakfast every morning in a hostel with a capacity of 100 people.  Out of those 100 people, 80 people used to complain every day that different items should be made instead of upma.*
*But, the other 20 people were happy to eat upma.  The remaining 80 people wanted to cook something other than upma.*

*The hostel warden voting method was proposed as some decision had to be reached in this chaotic situation. 

 According to this, whichever tiffin gets the most votes, that tiffin will be cooked that day.*

 *20 students who wanted Upma cast their vote accurately.  The remaining 80 people cast their vote as follows.*
 18 - Masala Dosa
 16 - Aloo Parotta & Dahi
 14 - Roti & Subg
 12 - Bread & Butter
 10 - Noodles
 10 - Idli Sambar

*Lesson:* As long as 80% of the population is selfish, divided and scattered, 20% will rule us.

Dhruv Rathee ek prasiddh YouTuber aur social media influencer hain, jo bharat ki rajneeti, samajik muddon, aur vatavaranik vishayon par videos banate hain. Unka mukhya kaam hai logon ko jagruk karne aur samajik sudhar ke liye awaaz uthane ka pryas karna. Ve Delhi, Bharat se hain.

Unke baare mein kya sahi hai ya galat, yeh kisi vyakti ya sthiti ke nazariye par nirbhar karta hai. Unka paisa kamane ka tarika mainly unke YouTube channel ke through hai, jahan unhe views aur advertisements se revenue milta hai.

Dhruv Rathee apne videos mein apni opinions aur research ke adhar par Bharat ki rajneeti aur samajik muddon par vichar vyakt karte hain. Parantu, har vyakti apni apni nazariya aur bias lekar bolta hai, isliye zaroori hai ki viewers multiple sources se information collect karein aur khud bhi tafteesh karein.

Kya aap unhe follow karna chahiye ya nahi, yeh aapke vichar aur unke content ko lekar hai. Zaroori hai ki aap apne jivan mein kisi ko follow karne se pehle unki soch, values, aur kaam ko dhyan mein rakhein aur phir apni faisla karein.

Dhruv Rathee ek prasiddh social media influencer hain, jo bharat ki rajneeti, samajik, aur vatavaranik mudde par apne YouTube channel aur social media platforms par videos banakar prasarit karte hain. Unka focus samajik sudhar aur rajneetik jagrukta par hota hai.ЁЯШКЁЯШКЁЯШК

1st- Dictatorship pe utar aaye 
2nd- unko maloom hai humara vote bank kon hai hum kaise election win kar sakte hain 
3rd- jab aapko ye sab maloom pad jaye to execute karna rahta hai

Bjp ko maloom hai Hindu Ram ke name se vote bank hai 
Hyderabad ke leader ko maloom hai Muslim vote bank hai to unhone Allah Allah karna hai wahi insaan Jharkhand aaye to St pe baat ki kyuki unko maloom hai Jharkhand me st vote bank hain 
Jharkhand ke leader ko maloom hai st vote bank to unhone always st ko support ki

In a simple word- government se majority Education or development...... ka talab karenge toh government Education, development,  jobs , home...... dengi

Hello this is a brief of my research work as a student just take some time to read it. This shall enlighten you about the contents on Social media.

Social Media: A Launchpad for Deeper Dives

Social media can be a great springboard to discover news and interesting topics. However, to truly understand what's happening, it's wise to explore further. Here's why:

curated content:┬аSocial media algorithms personalize your feed, showing you things you already agree with or find interesting. This can create an echo chamber, limiting your exposure to diverse viewpoints.

Focus on engagement:┬аEye-catching headlines and emotional content often grab attention on social media. While these can spark curiosity, they might not provide the full picture or the most reliable details.

Empowering Yourself as a News Consumer:

Variety is key:┬аExplore established news outlets like CNN or BBC for fact-checked reporting and diverse perspectives.

Dig deeper:┬аSocial media can spark your interest in a topic. Use it as a jumping-off point to find in-depth articles or reputable videos from established sources.

Be an active participant:┬аLook for news sources with clear citations and follow journalists known for their credibility.

Social media is a fantastic tool for connection and discovery, but it shouldn't be your only news source. By using it to launch yourself into deeper exploration with reliable media, you become a more informed and well-rounded news consumer.

The supremacy of the Constitution

Democracy

Federalism

Secularism

The protection of fundamental rights

The rule of law┬а

*резреж. рдЧреЛрдорд╛рдВрд╕ рдХрд╛рдпрджреЗрд╢реАрд░ рдХрд░рдгрд╛рд░*(рд╕рд░реНрд╡ рдХрд╛рд╣реА рдЦрд╛рдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рдЕрдзрд┐рдХрд╛рд░)

 *рдЬреЗ рд╣рд┐рдВрджреВ I.N.D.I. рдЖрдШрд╛рдбреА рдХрд┐рдВрд╡рд╛ рдиреЛрдЯрд╛рд▓рд╛ рдорддрджрд╛рди рдХрд░рдгреНрдпрд╛рдЪрд╛ рд╡рд┐рдЪрд╛рд░ рдХрд░рдд рдЖрд╣реЗрдд рддреНрдпрд╛рдВрдиреА рд╣реЗ рд╡рд╛рдЪрд╛ рдЖрдгрд┐ рд╡рд┐рдЪрд╛рд░ рдХрд░рд╛.*

For all the Whattsapp economists giving gyan, here is a more simplified explanation; 2 types of debt, internal and external. Internal is what the nations borrow from within the country. External is what the nations borrow from institutions outside. Indias internal debt is high due to borrowings categorised into marketable and non-marketable securities in order to fund massive Infrastructure projects and ongoing welfare schemes. So obviously it will be high. If you follow news, you will know that the government increased Capex in 24-25 to 11 trillion in 2024-25 which is around 4.5 times of the level in 14-15. But itтАЩs within India, remember this. ItтАЩs a trade off, you need to borrow to spend, you need to invest to build. Hence the increase in Internal Debt. Indias external debt is pretty much under control hovering around 19%, which is less than what it was when Modi government took over. This is the key as a higher external debt has the capacity to hurt the economy. GDP to debt ratio is how you measure it and India fares much better than most developed or developing economies even under those parameters. The debt-to-GDP ratio indicates how likely the country can pay off its debt. Investors often look at the debt-to-GDP metric to assess the government's ability to finance its debt. For the same reason, it is often important to see the nature of government's deficit. If the government is borrowing more for creating capital assets or on subsidies and other expenditure which doesn't result in the creation of any asset India has a healthy mix and given other macroeconomic indicators, itтАЩs all well placed. Note that most macro indicators such as inflation, current account deficit (CAD), PMI, GDP, stock market, trade are looking up and at all time best. So for a dolt like Rathee to make a lame comment on Indian Debt is like Lalu talking of capital adequacy ratio, he knows nothing

Sabki daal gal rahi hai! Aap chronology samajhiye:

1) Businessmen does bad things
2) ED sends notice with penalty of say 100 crore
3) Businessmen go to the regional offices for 1 on 1 meeting with ED regional heads
4) After the meeting, Businessmen, ED and BJP are happy, as Businessmen gets discount on penalty and has to only settle for say 50 crore 
5) Businessmen in most cases do hawala transaction and in "some" cases for big payouts buy the electoral bonds. So the "some" numbers you saw on electoral bond disclosure is far lower than actual numbers, electoral bonds might have been brought only by 20%-30% of companies who were served ED/IT notice, rest money is through hawala.
6) ED either postpones or settles the case and everyone is happy. In some cases gives tax exemption, grants projects, changes policies in favor of businessmen etc.

Moral of the story: BJP Happy, ED Happy, Businessmen Happy! 
All businessmen, Chartered Accountants are aware about this but everyone is getting something or the other benefit.

What about common man? - who cares!

Actual impact: Businessmen now has to recover 50 crore by hook or crook, so he exploits the rules further, exploits workers, exploits environment. On the other hand BJP, uses the money to further their agenda of communal polarization by employing dumb 20-45 year aged kids as city and regional operations incharge for handling money and media (whatsapp, news papers, websites, channels, youtube, local organizations etc.). And, the common man keeps paying taxes, hopes for better infra and life quality and gets pennies instead.

In South, fact is people don't see Modi with same reverence as they used to with Vajpayee ji. Vajpayee was a stalwart leader and inspired trust and respect. 

Present PM is seen as an electioneer like profiteer, marketeer etc. He appears during election season. Wherever he goes, there is traffic jam. He speaks animatedly but no connect with people. Presently he is popular and powerful because of which he is winning. He has delivered no development. Mistreated the states by holding their money from centre.
He is no more than fancy dress and cutouts. Can't be trusted with votes. Mere scare crow who may last for few more years and he is a nonconsequencial figure. 

In Karnataka Modi has been losing (26/28to 65/135) despite the state being a Hindutva/BJP bastion even before his arrival in national politics. Trust deficit is the key factor. It is BJP Vs BJP. 

In Tamil Nadu His master's voice (Annamalai) is filling media while Modi has just flashed Katchateevu which at this point is untimely and nonconsequencial. 

Modi plays what he is best at, Electioneering - Roadshow/ Showering with petals/ Podium speech/ Fancy dress/ Cutouts. Modi Modi Modi ............. Sometimes it pays and many times it doesn't. He doesn't seem to care. 

For BJP hatrick for Modi is the only goal. Electoral Bonds, Proportional representation for OBC, Manipur violence. These are too trivial !

There're so many companies who offered electoral bonds to the BJP even though BJP has not expected them to do so. They offered bonds as a token of their appreciation to the sincere service of the BJP to the nation. and it has nothing to do with the projects they received from the government.
The link between the electoral bonds offered to the BJP and the projects the government offered to the individual companies is the pure and  creative imagination of those who who are interested to see wrong things in every thing and anything the BJP government does. 
I might have offered electoral bonds thinking that I may not get the project with out offering it not knowing the in the due process as per the merits I have already been decided to be the eligible one for the project which has nothing to to do with the electoral bonds I offered to the  government.
Don't you understand this possibility or chance occurance? It has happened with many companies. How can the courts or opposition blame the BJP for this? 
Just because the government offered a project does the government stand ineligible to receive donation offered by that company as an admirer of Its policies and genuine sevice to the nation? Or the companies which received projects from the government stand ineligible to offer donation as a token of their pure admiration to the BJP party? 
Is there any code of conduct that prevents the benefectors from offering electoral bonds to the BJP or offering bonds to the BJP before it received projects from the government? (Though these two  are purely confidential.). What's this nuisance in the country?

Accept the possibility that a company would have donated to the BJP unmindful of return gift from the BJ P of BJP government offerering projects to people unmindful of the fact whether those parties have donated to them.

The details of donor needs to be kept secret for the sake of the safety of donors. Bcz if a party to whom the donor had not donated comes to power may take revenge actions against the donor. That is the reason in case of electoral bonds the information is kept secret. Regarding the routing of black money, it is not possible, bcz all the purchase of bond is done though Banking channel and if any black money comes to the Banking it first comes to the notice of Income tax department. Hence those opposing the concept of electoral bond need to understand the practicality. The only flaw in the scheme was that they removed the cap on investing in bond. Otherwise there is no any flaw in the scheme which the people opposing should understand including the Supreme court.

We should assess Modi's previous and current government and governance, comparing their policies, lifestyles, and standards of living. We should evaluate various complex and pressing issues affecting the nation, touching countless lives of citizens, such as infrastructure, electricity, water, healthcare, education, employment, and law/order. Only then can we discern between selfish, greedy, deceitful, worldly, hypocritical, antisocial behaviors and those of integrity, honesty, virtue, and righteousness, guided by ethical principles, morals, and spirituality. Such individuals who govern with a noble character like Narendra Modi, even if they become rulers, are considered fortunate for the populace.
